node.title: Serial conman Peter Foster arrested after dodging Sydney court hearing six months earlier
node.alt: Peter Foster sits on the sand in handcuffs flanked by plain clothes police.
node.description: Australian Federal Police officers arrest serial conman Peter Foster in Victoria, six months after he failed to appear before a Sydney court on fraud charges.
node.content: ["Australian Federal Police (AFP) officers have arrested serial conman Peter Foster in Victoria, six months after he failed to appear before a Sydney court on fraud charges.", "Foster, 59, was originally arrested in Port Douglas by Queensland Police in August last year.", "He was granted bail in NSW in March under strict conditions but failed to appear at a scheduled hearing on May 20.", "Authorities said the monitoring device attached to his ankle stopped sending a signal and he was then officially declared a fugitive.", "Foster was today arrested near the Victorian town of Gisborne, in the Macedon Ranges.", "\"We have been working hand in glove together [with Queensland Police] and this man would still be at large without their operational input,'' AFP Assistant Commissioner Nigel Ryan said in a statement.", "\"There is no safe haven for criminals in Australia. The AFP,\u00a0with our partner agencies, are relentless in ensuring those wanted for crimes face justice.\"", "Foster is facing multiple state charges relating to an alleged $2 million fraud.", "At the time of his disappearance, Foster's lawyer Justin Lewis was confounded by his client's failure to appear in court while he was attempting to secure an\u00a0adjournment.", "\"My client was at my office, I saw him with my own eyes,\" Mr Lewis said.", "\"He conveyed to me that he was coming down to court\u00a0and I haven't been able to locate him since.\"", "Mr\u00a0Lewis returned to the court later in the afternoon and said he wasn't able to get further instructions from his client.", "\"In other words, you can't find Mr Foster,\" Chief Magistrate Graeme Henson said.", "\"That is the case,\" Mr Lewis replied.", "More to come."]
